sourcesContent:
// Page for rules import React from 'react'; import { View, Text, StyleSheet, ScrollView } from 'react-native'; import Card from '../components/Card' import {PIG, SHEEP, BLOOD, BlOODS, DOUBLER, SPECIAL_CARDS} from '../components/specialCards' import Hand from '../components/Hand' import { CardInterface } from '../types'; const HandExample1: CardInterface[] = [ PIG, BlOODS[2], BlOODS[7] ] const HandExample2: CardInterface[] = [ SHEEP, BlOODS[12], BlOODS[8], DOUBLER ] const HandExample3: CardInterface[] = [...BlOODS, PIG] const RulesPage: React.FC = () => { return ( Rules of Gongzhu By Yue Zhang Gongzhu (lit. "Pushing the Pig") is a traditional Chinese card game. It is usually played by 4 players with the standard deck of 52 playing cards. The goal of Gongzhu is to score the highest points by avoiding penalty cards and collecting beneficial ones. Gameplay 1. The game is played with 4 players and a standard deck of 52 cards. 2. Cards are dealt equally to all players, with each player receiving 13 cards. 3. Players take turns playing one card each. The first card determines the suit for that round. 4. Players must follow suit if possible. If a player cannot follow suit, they may play any card. 5. The highest card of the lead suit wins the round, and the winner collects all cards played. Note that Ace is the largest and 2 is the smallest in any suit. Card Values The following cards have special values: - Queen of Spade (♠): Known as the Pig. Its value is -100 points. Try your best to avoid collecting the Pig! - Jack of Diamond (♦): Known as the Sheep. Its value is +100 points. Try your best to catch the Sheep! - Hearts (♥): Known as the Bloods. Most of heart cards have negative points. - 2, 3 and 4 of Heart have no values. - 5 to 10 of Heart are -10 points each. - Jack, Queen, King and Ace of Heart worth -20, -30, -40 and -50 points, respectively. - Ten of Club (♣): Known as the Doubler. Your score will double if you collect the Doubler, no matter it is positive or negative. - All the other cards do not have any values. Score Calculation After each game, the score of each player is determined by their collected cards that have values. It is simply the sum of the values of each card. If they have the Doubler (10 of Club), the score would double. Special Situations - If a player collects only the Doubler, without the Pig, the Sheep, nor any Blood, the Doubler will worth +50 points. - If a player collects all the hearts including 2, 3 and 4, the values of the hearts will become positive. (+200 points in total) - If a player collects the Pig, the Sheep, the Doubler and all the hearts including 2, 3 and 4, the values of the pig will become positive. (+100 points) Example 1 The score of the following player is -100-0-10=-110. Example 2 The score of the following player is (+100-50-10)*2=+80. Example 3 The score of the following player is +200-100=+100. Winning and Losing You and the player directly opposite you are teammates. Your team's score is the combined total of both players' individual scores. The game is typically played across multiple rounds, with scores for both teams accumulating over time. The game continues until one team's score reaches or exceeds +1000 points, or falls to or below -1000 points. A team wins by reaching or exceeding +1000 points. Conversely, a team loses if their score falls to or below -1000 points. Declaration Mode To make the game more exciting, you can enable card declarations in the beginning of the game! Now there is an extra declaration phase before the first round of game. During the declaration phase, each player takes turns to decide whether to declare special card(s) in their hand. The special cards are the Pig, the Sheep, the Big Blood (Ace of Heart) and the Doubler. If a player decides to declare one of those special cards, they can either declare it secretly (closedly) or openly. - A secretly delcared card has doubled (times 2) effect. That is to say, a secretly declared Pig is -200 instead of -100, a secretly declared Sheep is +200 instead of +100, a secretly declared Doubler quadruple one's score, and a secretly declared Big Blood causes all Bloods' scores to double. When one secretly declares a card, they does not need to show that card until that card is played. - A openly delcared card has quadrupled (times 4) effect! When one secretly declares a card, they must always show that declared card. Note that in order to prevent openly declared cards from being too overpowered, it is not allowed to play an openly card in the first round of the suit of that card (unless that card is the only one in that suit). For example, one cannot play an openly declared Pig in the first round of spade, or an openly declared Doubler in the first round of Heart. Have fun playing Gongzhu!

© 2025 Yue Zhang. All rights reserved.

 ); }; const styles = StyleSheet.create({ container: { flex: 1, backgroundColor: '#f8f9fa', }, contentContainer: { padding: 20, }, title: { fontSize: 24, fontWeight: 'bold', textAlign: 'center', marginBottom: 20, color: '#343a40', }, sectionTitle: { fontSize: 20, fontWeight: 'bold', marginTop: 20, marginBottom: 10, color: '#495057', }, sectionSubTitle: { fontSize: 18, fontWeight: 'bold', marginTop: 20, marginBottom: 10, color: '#222222', }, text: { fontSize: 16, lineHeight: 24, color: '#212529', marginBottom: 10, }, bulletedList: { fontSize: 16, lineHeight: 24, color: '#212529', marginLeft: 20, }, highlight: { backgroundColor: '#FFFF99', color: '#000', fontWeight: 'bold', paddingHorizontal: 2, borderRadius: 4, }, strongHighlight: { backgroundColor: '#FF9999', color: '#fff', paddingHorizontal: 4, borderRadius: 4, fontWeight: 'bold', }, footer: { height: 50, justifyContent: "center", alignItems: "center", }, footerText: { fontSize: 16, color: "#333", }, }); export default RulesPage;
